Fields.DialogueText: Come in!
*KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK*
Come in.
What a time of the night to be playing Knock Down Ginger... Don't you know there's a war on?!
*ALARM*
Gah! And now my yelling has alerted the Morganas to our whereabouts! Looks like our prankster's moment of infamy is up...
@BATTLE
Zulu, good work out there. I can always find you in the midst of battle.
Of course, Captain!
By the way...
Yes?

Fields.MenuText: Do you believe in hauntings?

Fields.DialogueText: Like ghosts? Well, I believe that ancestral spirits watch over and protect us, but it sounds like you're talking about the malevolent sort.

Fields.MenuText: Are you aware of the game Knock Down Ginger?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course - although I know it by the name Knock and Run! A lot more literal, but nothing compared to the Scottish terminology. They call it Chappy!

Fields.MenuText: Did you hear any mysterious knocking before the attack?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing of the sort. Do you have a clear conscience, Captain? Perhaps your tell-tale heart is trying to make you repent.
I could have sworn someone was knocking my door at this ungodly hour.
Ah... In that case, I may have something to admit...
So it was you!
Yes, but you don't understand!
Tell me in the morning, Zulu. I can barely keep my eyes open. I trust I can go to sleep without any further interruptions.
Yes, Captain...
I see. So you knock on the doors of every crew member every night?
I like the crew to know that I will always be watching over them, even while they sleep. It also helps me stay sane - enforcing such a daily ritual into my life.

Fields.MenuText: Just a knock? No bedtime story or warm milk?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not a maid! Even if that would be ideal, I'd never get to sleep myself!

Fields.MenuText: How long does that all take?

Fields.DialogueText: I make sure to start around 20:00 and I usually finish around midnight. I was especially tired yesterday, so my knocking may have been a tad louder than usual.

Fields.MenuText: You truly are dedicated, huh?

Fields.DialogueText: The crew are the backbone of any vessel. I will protect them to my dying breath and it is important that they know this. At least, in my opinion.
Personally, I think you can skip my door next time, Zulu. As Captain, I should be the one protecting you!
I know that. But... for some reason... I can't help but to want to keep you safe.
Zulu...
I worry that, should I pursue the feelings I have for you, I may become biased in my combative procedure. I should protect everyone equally, but if you are in peril, I... I...!
You don't need to worry about me, Zulu. I'm not going anywhere. Focus on the crew and I promise, I will never leave your side.
I'll hold you to that, Captain. Should you perish in battle I will wait out the remainder of my existence before hunting you down for a heavy scolding in the afterlife!
It's a date.
*ALARM*
Allow me to put my money where my mouth is! Focus on the mission, Zulu! Leave everything else to me!
@BATTLE
That was quite a battle. You really are skilled at combat.
You'll make me blush, Captain...

Fields.MenuText: Where did you learn such techniques?

Fields.DialogueText: Watching my seniors, mostly. The older Belles have a lot to offer and I can't help but hang on their every word.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you should be the captain.

Fields.DialogueText: One day, it would be nice to lead a team. I enjoy watching and learning from the senior Belles, but I've learned just as much about piloting a team from you, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: For a destroyer, however, you don't seem that... destructive?

Fields.DialogueText: In a perfect world, all disagreements would be settled with words. However, I cannot look past the sins these monsters have committed. The time for talking is over.
I like to think of myself as well-versed in the art of combat.
Personally, I think you rely too much on protocol. Being stuck behind a desk would dull anyone's intuition.
Care to take me on in a battle of words? Unlike the Morganas, we can settle our disagreements civilly.
You're on! I have to say, I don't like your chances!
@ALARM
The talking will have to wait! Let's silence these Morganas first!
Aye-aye, Captain!
@BATTLE
You can't always rely solely on what works on paper when devising a strategy. It's all well and good learning to swim through a manual, but nothing prepares you for being dropped in at the deep end!
Yes, but surely you will agree that preparing for an enemy's attack is better than relying on reactions. Prevention is always better than cure.
My throat is starting to hurt! What say we call it even and pop the kettle on?
Sounds like a plan.
Captain... Would you make this pot...?

Fields.MenuText: I'm at a loss for words...

Fields.DialogueText: Saying it is embarrassing enough! Just do it already!

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm very particular when it comes to tea prep. However, I want to taste the tea you make for me...

Fields.MenuText: How do you take it?

Fields.DialogueText: Honestly, you still don't know?! Two sugars and a splash of milk... I've never had someone make tea for me before. But even if it's terrible, I want to try yours.
Gee, thanks...
*ALARM*
The kettle will take about thirty seconds to boil. Think you can finish things before then?
I only need twenty!
@BATTLE
So, what do you think?
I... I love it, Captain...
Is that so? What exactly do you love about it?
It's so... you know, I just can't put it into words...

Fields.MenuText: Two sugars and a splash of milk, right?

Fields.DialogueText: You didn't happen to use one of those oversized novelty spoons, by any chance?

Fields.MenuText: It's that bad?

Fields.DialogueText: No, Captain! The sweetness only makes it better! Look! *Gulp* *gulp* *gulp*! Now, if you could fetch the medical team, I'd like to run a quick diabetes check.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you could teach me how to make the perfect cuppa?

Fields.DialogueText: I fear that your time at the naval academy will pale in comparison to the harshness I will inflict!
*ALARM*
These Morganas look parched! What say we send them to the drink!
@BATTLE
What's that you have there, Zulu?
A new miniature garden! One of the crew picked it up for me!

Fields.MenuText: What happened to your old garden?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing. There was just a bit of crossbreeding in the small space. Nothing worse than a Frankenstein basil-mint-parsley monstrosity!

Fields.MenuText: What are you growing at the moment?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm still laying the groundwork and ensuring the soil is fresh. I haven't decided what I want to plant yet.

Fields.MenuText: I've never had much of a green thumb myself.

Fields.DialogueText: I recommend you try it, Captain! Growing plants is very therapeutic.
How long will it take to grow... whatever it is you plant.
It all depends on the species. Some plants are happy to be left alone and only given food and water. Some, however, require constant care and attention.
I can think of a few recruits on deck like that...
Proceeding at a comfortable pace is essential for a healthy life.
Agreed. There's no need to rush into things. Everything will work out in time.
We are still talking about plants here, right, Captain?
*Ahem* Of course.
*ALARM*
Wonderful! Morgana remains should make for excellent fertilizer!
Remind me to never get on your bad side, Zulu...
@BATTLE
While we're docked, Captain, I'd like to pick up some poppy seeds.
Poppies? That doesn't sound like your usual witch doctor combination of herbs and spices.
As the war drags on, I'm feeling more and more inclined to honour those who have lost their lives in battle. Not only against the Morganas, but in the Great War as well.
Of course. Once they bloom, we can pass the poppies around to the crew and we can keep the fallen's spirits alive.
I don't want to put you out of pocket, however. We should bolster our firepower as well, but do you think we have enough funding for both?

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure it will be fine.

Fields.DialogueText: Then I'll say no more about it!

Fields.MenuText: Let's pick up the seeds for now and revisit the weaponry another time.

Fields.DialogueText: As you wish, Captain.
I'd enjoy tending to such a respectable flower alongside you, Zulu. Lord knows I would not be where I am today without the sacrifices of the previous generation.
Wonderful, Captain! Let's clear these Morganas out and get gardening!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: The gun budget and the flower budget are two different things. No worries.

Fields.DialogueText: Extra bouquets for our quarters, then.
If we leave the garden out here, the plants can get a lot of sun.

Fields.MenuText: Aren't you worried about a sudden attack?
I don't think plants are too fond of seawater.

Fields.DialogueText: These poppies will be worn by those in war zones. They need to be able to withstand such an attack, so better they learn early!
Are you saying I can't keep a steady ship, Captain? I will ensure no water spills onto this deck!

Fields.MenuText: The weather's been nice lately, but aren't you worried it may turn?

Fields.DialogueText: I'll be attentive to the changing of the tides. It's easy to predict a sudden downpour if you look hard enough at the sky!
*ALARM*
Better put the garden somewhere safe, Zulu! With me!
Yes, Captain!
@BATTLE
I think you might be onto something with this gardening, Zulu. After that battle, I feel completely at peace.
I'd like to try it on a larger scale one day. After I purchase a home and have a garden to myself.
I'd like that too.
I didn't necessarily mean with you, Captain!
Neither did I!
My feelings for you have been made evident, but I don't know if I'm ready to share a roof with you yet! I'm sorry! Please give me time!
I proposed nothing of the sort! Let's just get back to work!
The poppies are coming along nicely, aren't they, Captain?
I'm surprised the buds have sprouted so quickly. You must have the magic touch.
After these blossom, I must return to growing medicinal herbs. Out on the sea, away from any kind of medical delivery system, they may prove vital in a pinch.
Hold that thought, Zulu. What's that in the distance?
Morganas?

Fields.MenuText: I believe so, but...
I can't quite make it out...
It couldn't possibly be...

Fields.DialogueText: A fleet is emerging from the fog!
We're unprepared! Protect the garden! Man your stations! Hoist the mainsail! Not necessarily in that order!
Don't worry, Captain! Leave it to me! I thrive in high-pressure situations like this!
@BATTLE
Never rule out Morganas, Captain!
But nothing, Captain! We know an emergency when we see it!
Zulu... I don't know what to say...
Poor babies... They never even had a chance at life...
I'm sure we can pick some new seeds up at the next port.
Normally, I wouldn't care about losing the lives of a couple of plants, but... seeing as we cared for them together, Captain, they were almost like my children...

Fields.MenuText: We'll get you some new poppies! Better poppies!

Fields.DialogueText: Please, just let me mourn in peace...

Fields.MenuText: I know a child is not something so easily replaced.

Fields.DialogueText: Please, Captain, the metaphor was just that. I'll be fine in the morning.

Fields.MenuText: By that logic, don't you mean "our" children?

Fields.DialogueText: *INTENSE BLUSHING*
Regardless, we'd better make a stop at that dock up ahead. That fleet wiped out nearly half of all our supplies.
Yes, Captain. This time, let's be sure to... Captain? Your side...
Huh? Oh, this... Never you mind, a stray piece of shrapnel must have nicked me. I believe it was the Morgana with the purple sail that did it. You know, the one that got away.
On second thoughts, Captain, there has been a change of plans.
There has?
I'm sure that the said purple-flagged Morgana is the one responsible for the destruction of my garden.
How could you tell in such a chaotic--
Belle's instinct! I'm sure of it! I have never been more sure of anything in my life! I will hunt that Morgana down if it's the last thing I do. No one messes with those near and dear to me.
They were only plants, Zulu...
What's that? Oh, right! It's the principle of the matter, Captain. Come with me, you need to lie down.
I spy some Morganas blocking the entrance to the dock. Are you okay to take them out yourself?
Of course.
@BATTLE
Are you feeling better, Captain?
Much better. It's all thanks to your home remedies.
This concoction had already been made from my original garden. The taste is bitter, but make sure you drink it all.

Fields.MenuText: Have you always been this caring?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure if I like the phrasing of that, Captain. Has there been a point in time where you questioned my compassion?

Fields.MenuText: You're a real Florence Nightingale. Now all we need is the nurse's uniform.

Fields.DialogueText: Careful, Captain. I may have to feed you a sedative if you act up too much.

Fields.MenuText: I'd rather you save your medicines for the crew.

Fields.DialogueText: Cut off the head and the body will soon crumble. Should something happen to you, Captain, I don't know what I-- WE... would do...
I really am feeling better, so no more doting, okay? I've been meaning to ask about that fire in your eyes for some time now. Care to explain?
Fire?
Come now, Zulu. How long have I known you? I may not know the kind of tea you like, but I can see when something is bothering you.
That Morgana... I can't stop thinking about it...
An eye for an eye makes the whole world blind.
You'll have to forgive me, Captain. I don't see myself letting this go so easily.
Nothing for it then. Here, take this.
What is...?
A map. One of the crew swiped it after boarding the Morgana ship and taking it down. With this, we can track the enemy's movements and--
Captain, you're a star! You are about to witness a true hunter in action.
Zulu, wait!
Yes?
Just so you know... I'm sure the poppies wouldn't want you risking your life to avenge them. They care about you very much and would not have wanted to see you hurt.
Be that as it may, Captain, the poppies have done so much for me and I will never sit idly by while someone disrespects them... The poppies, that is...
Of course... the poppies...
Dismissed...
Well... no.
Even destroyers are capable of empathy.
Heh. Especially destroyers, some might say.
Yes, yes, knowing rules and breaking them and all that.
@BATTLE
Before we can get started with our hunt, we should ensure our reserves are in good supply.
That stray Morgana managed to evade our every attack. We wasted so much ammunition firing on the open water.
While I would love to receive an upgrade, the well-being of the crew should always take priority.
Agreed. What do you propose?
We must ensure we have enough food and water for the men aboard ship. Do you think we will have the funds to purchase any new artillery?

Fields.MenuText: Better hold off. Like you said, the crew's lives come first.

Fields.DialogueText: I was thinking the same thing.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure we can pick up a thing or two...

Fields.DialogueText: You don't need to tell me twice!
Now then, that Morgana looked to be heading westward. Can we make chase in time?
Who do you think you're talking to, Captain?!
*ALARM*
Perfect! A warm-up! Just what I need! Captain, please take care of the necessary purchases and meet me back here post-haste!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: That's the Admiralty's concern, not ours.

Fields.DialogueText: Too true, Captain. Just bill the Navy, as Enterprise says.
If we follow along this course, we should be able to cut that runaway off before it can rejoin a neighbouring fleet.
I see.
We may have to take shifts with regards to sleeping. Travelling through the night will become a necessity.

Fields.MenuText: All of this for one lowly Morgana?

Fields.DialogueText: If you'd had the opportunity to chase Attila down before he reconnected with the Hun army, wouldn't you do it? That one Morgana could go on to commit countless atrocities if not dealt with.

Fields.MenuText: Watching your process is very interesting, Zulu.

Fields.DialogueText: Mankind has always been fascinated by the hunting styles of various animals. While I would not compare myself to a wild beast I can see some resemblance between myself and, let's say, a proud lioness!

Fields.MenuText: You should get some sleep. I don't mind staying up all night.

Fields.DialogueText: If anything, it should be the other way around, Captain! We Belles have much more of an energy reserve than humans do.
We'll stay awake together. How about that?
If you insist.
*ALARM*
We have company. Let's deal with them quickly!
Yes, Captain!
@BATTLE
I feel like a small child again having a sleepover with my chums.
I've never been to a sleepover before. What kind of things are customary for such an occasion?

Fields.MenuText: We could tell scary stories?

Fields.DialogueText: I can't think of anything much scarier than the hell of war. Feel free to try, though.

Fields.MenuText: Pillow fight?

Fields.DialogueText: Pillow…? Fight…? Are the pillows lined with explosives? Otherwise, it doesn't seem like much of a duel.

Fields.MenuText: Share secrets?

Fields.DialogueText: I try to live my life as openly as possible. I fear I would not have much to tell. Although, I would be quite interested to hear of YOUR infidelities, Captain!
In any case, let me get out from behind this desk.
Captain?
The working day is done, Zulu - let's just say the Captain has checked out until sunrise. Even I would like some time to relax.
But, Captain! You're sitting on the floor! How unbecoming!
Please, join me. We will surround ourselves with a pillow barricade to protect against the Morganas. That's an order!
I thought the Captain had "checked out?"
… You got me. Please?
*Sigh* If you are sure this is a proper sleepover procedure, then I will abide by it.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Despite your praise, I don't know how well these pillows will act as a defence, Captain! Best let me take care of them first!
@BATTLE
*YAAAAWN* Huh? Buh? Muh? Morganas!
Relax, Captain. You nodded off for a while.
What time is it?
Just gone 03:00.

Fields.MenuText: You should have woken me.

Fields.DialogueText: You looked so peaceful. I couldn't possibly have disturbed you.

Fields.MenuText: What have you been doing all this time?

Fields.DialogueText: Devising strategies, mostly. In my mind, of course. I worried the scratching of pen to paper may have woken you.

Fields.MenuText: Even in my dreams I cannot escape the Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: People say dreams are your mind trying to fix problems you could not solve during the day. If anything, I'd say dreaming about Morganas is very helpful!
Why are you all the way over there?
I…? I did not think--
You must be freezing. Here, come under the blanket.
… *SHUFFLE*
That's better. You shouldn't push yourself so hard, Zulu. Especially not for m-- I mean, the poppies' sake.
Actually, Captain, in the spirit of the sleepover, I have a secret to confess.
Is that so?
I'm not so thirsty for revenge for my garden's sake. I wish to wreak havoc on those who injured you.
You're joking! I'm stunned…
As unprofessional as it may be and as loudly as the tactician in my mind plots a course for all the ways our relationship could fail…
Zulu…
The destroyer inside me can't help but want to dive headfirst into the fray!
*ALARM*
We're… under attack…
So we are… I had a very nice time at my first sleepover, Captain.
Even if I was asleep for most of it?
I will treasure these brief respites from battle until the day I die.
Don't let that day be today! I'm right behind you!
@BATTLE
Good morning, Captain! You're up early, considering we spent most of the night chatting.
I had the strangest dream and couldn't get back to sleep afterwards.
Morganas again.
No, it was--
No, Captain! The Morganas are back again! Please help me deal with them!
Oh! Apologies, I'm still a little weary.
@BATTLE
So what was this dream about, Captain?
I'm not sure who it was, but someone in the sky was staring down at me. No matter where I went, they would sit atop the clouds and watch my every move.
That may have been the spirits of your ancestors, you know. The connection between the spirit realm and the mortal plane is a lot stronger in dreams - though I'm sure they're watching you even now.

Fields.MenuText: So I have to live out my days without any privacy?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't think you need to worry about scandalising anyone, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I did always wonder about life beyond all this. What's out there, waiting.

Fields.DialogueText: Spirits are not aliens, Captain. Honestly... humans claim to be at the top of the evolutionary food chain, but still fear hidden predators like a common wildebeest. Try not to mix the two up.

Fields.MenuText: Why can they reach me so easily in my dreams?

Fields.DialogueText: During a deep sleep, your mind is freed up from all the stresses of the day. It makes it much easier to barge through!

Fields.MenuText: I was never that close with my extended family. I doubt they care enough to watch over me.

Fields.DialogueText: You shouldn't say such things, Captain. Blood runs thicker than water. Even if their feelings were never expressed audibly, I'm sure your family loved you very much.
What about you, Zulu? Is there anyone to look over you?
Alas, all my family still remain alive.
Maybe you shouldn't start that sentence with "alas"...
I'll have to look over you in the meantime, then.
Please do!
It was like they were... commanding us. Bestowing gifts... sending us this way and that... It was very disconcerting.

Fields.MenuText: Be that as it may, all the relatives that matter to me are still alive. Thankfully.
Yeah, I think I'm just happier not imagining my invisible family peering over my shoulder.

Fields.DialogueText: But there's more than that, Captain. Generations upon generations led to you, even if you didn't know them - and I'm sure they're proud.
It's nice to finally stretch my legs! These all-nighters trying to flank our escapee have really done a number on my lower body.
If we are to stick to your ruthlessly strict schedule, we'll need to be back out onto the waters in less than ten minutes.
There isn't much to do, I believe. Restock our supplies, pick up new torpedoes, purchase some soil...
I think you snuck something in there...
Our elusive Morgana managed to escape my fire once before. I worry they may be able to do it again.
I see.
I'll leave the decision down to you.

Fields.MenuText: Very well, if you insist.
I'm sure you'll be able to sink them this time.

Fields.DialogueText: That praise is all the support I need!
You're so good to me, Captain!
Now, let's get back out there before the Morganas do some shopping of their own.
Aye-aye, Captain.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: More is more, as they say. I never say no to more steel.

Fields.DialogueText: Nor I, Captain. And I'll put it to responsible use.
Ah, Zulu! Here you are!
Captain?
What are you doing down here?
I found myself nodding off in your quarters. The shrieking from the engine room is enough to keep anyone awake.
Zulu...
I've plotted a course through this rocky mountainside. It will be a tight squeeze, and my hull may sustain some damage, but--
Zulu, stop this.
Captain?

Fields.MenuText: You're going to burn out.
You're going to hurt yourself.
It pains me to see you like this.

Fields.DialogueText: As long as you keep pumping fuel into the furnace, I'll never burn out.
A couple of scratches are nothing compared to the elation I'll feel after sinking that Morgana.
Just stick to worrying about yourself, Captain. It was reckless abandon that got you injured the first time!
You don't need to do everything yourself. I know you want to protect me and the crew, but we're all on this ride together. We can help.
I... I can't risk losing you...
I'm the captain of the great destroyer Zulu! I stare in the face of death with each passing day. I'm afraid that worry is a package deal.
Ha! When you put it that way, I can see how my constant battling must dampen your spirits as well.
That it does.
Very well. I will hunt down this runaway Morgana at a slower pace. It may take a few extra days to catch up, but we will do so with our spirits and energy intact.
Wonderful. Tea?
I'd love some!
Zulu? Do you have ants in your pants?
Taking your advice to heart, Captain, I've decided to dive into my hobbies as a distraction from battle.
I see. And your hobby is imaginary grape crushing?
Rude! I'm dancing, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I've never seen such a dance before.
Do you have a favourite dance?

Fields.DialogueText: I've never danced a dance I didn't enjoy, but the faster the better. However un-British that might be.
Then there is still a lot more of the world left for you to explore!

Fields.MenuText: I'm not much of a dancer myself.

Fields.DialogueText: I'd be happy to teach you! I would just need to invest in some steel-plated boots beforehand!
My stress levels have been soaring as well recently...
You're welcome to join me, Captain. I would also enjoy a more spacious dance hall such as your quarters as opposed to the cluttered interior of the mess hall.
*ALARM*
Very well. Stop by after you waltz these Morganas into submission!
Yes, Captain!
@BATTLE
Captain, you're too modest! Your footwork may not be perfect, but you can dance as well as the rest of them.

Fields.MenuText: I was forced to take lessons at one point. I guess they paid off after all.

Fields.DialogueText: *Hmmm hmmmm hmmm*
Zulu?
We have no music, so I thought it would be nice to have a rhythm to our slow dance.

Fields.MenuText: We'll have to have a proper dance after the war is over.

Fields.DialogueText: I'd like that very much, although I think we both could do with a refresher course.

Fields.MenuText: What is that tune you're singing?

Fields.DialogueText: Johann Strauss II - The Blue Danube. A classic waltz! I'm usually all for energetic dance styles... but for some reason, I feel inclined to slow dance when I'm with you.

Fields.MenuText: Slow dance?!

Fields.DialogueText: Even a destroyer such as myself is capable of such things, Captain! Please, take my waist without looking in my eyes too much.
This is a lot easier than I thought it would be.
Even a gentle rocking back and forth can be misconstrued as a slow dance to the untrained eye.
Sorry if my hands are sweaty...
Sorry if my heart is beating too quickly.
Zulu... I--!
*ALARM*
It's okay, Captain. You don't have to say it. Trust me, I know more than anyone what you want to express.
Now, then, you should lead. You are the captain, after all.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: You are a delightful liar.
Yeah. It's true.

Fields.DialogueText: According to the map, we should be closing in on our escapee Morgana very shortly.
I think I see something up ahead...
That's it, Captain! I'd recognize that dastardly flag anywhere!

Fields.MenuText: What do you propose we do?

Fields.DialogueText: You're the captain, aren't you?! I'm just the navigator!

Fields.MenuText: Let's sink it!

Fields.DialogueText: I couldn't have put it better myself!

Fields.MenuText: Perhaps we should retreat...

Fields.DialogueText: After spending so much time getting here? I know you are worried about my safety, Captain, but please do not let that cloud your judgement.
*ALARM*
Shut that off! Does a lion announce its pounce on an unsuspecting antelope?!
Good thinking. We'll shroud ourselves in smoke and make an approach.
It appears to have already gained some allies. Let's take care of the appetizers first before moving on to the main course!
@BATTLE
It appears this Morgana evaded destruction through more than just sheer luck!
So fast! So agile! I can't land a hit! Why won't you die?!
Don't get riled up, Zulu. Just think of it like any other Morgana and not one who personally wronged you.
*Inhale*
I'm right here beside you.
*Exhale*
You're right, Captain. I'm at constant odds with myself. At times I favor a tactical approach. At other intervals, I want to go in all guns blazing.
I wouldn't want either side of you to overshadow the other. Finding the balance is key.
I think you've helped me find that, Captain. Thank you. Now, watch me go to work!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Don't lose your head, Zulu!
Keep calm!
It wants you to lose your temper!

Fields.DialogueText: Gah! I'll drown myself if it means taking this monster out with me.
It's... over...

Fields.MenuText: How do you feel?

Fields.DialogueText: You were right, Captain. That was not as satisfying as I thought it would be.

Fields.MenuText: Are you relieved?

Fields.DialogueText: A weight has certainly been lifted... but now I see that I'm the one who put it there.

Fields.MenuText: Is revenge as sweet as they say it is?

Fields.DialogueText: You humans have a lot of descriptives for revenge. "Revenge is sweet." "Revenge is a dish best served cold." You make it sound like ice cream... which has never been my favourite.
Don't look so glum, Zulu. That Morgana will think twice about bothering anyone from now on.
You're right, Captain... but when she does think twice, we'll need to be prepared. Perhaps with bigger and better weaponry?
Of course. Anything to get that smile back on your face.
I was only joking, Captain, but I'll allow you to spoil me just this once.
Come below deck. There's something I want to show you.
As you wish.
@BATTLE
Her and a whole squadron of her friends! Hold on tight, Captain!
There! I can see her!
What is...?
The humidity from the galley provides the perfect amount of moisture to keep the plants healthy. If you really work at it, anyway.
But... the sun...
I've been periodically taking them to the surface when I know you'll be busy.
But... from where...?
I had a crew member pick up some seeds during our last stop.
You really did it. You managed to grow poppies on a destroyer.

Fields.MenuText: Will you try one on?

Fields.DialogueText: I'd be happy to! We must hand these out to the crew at once!

Fields.MenuText: It really was an enjoyable experience.

Fields.DialogueText: You should listen to me more often, Captain! You'll soon learn that I'm not just a weapon capable of mass destruction.

Fields.MenuText: I wanted to do something nice for you.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain... I'm at a loss for words.
*ALARM*
Make sure these poppies stay safe. I do NOT want to go on another wild goose chase!
@BATTLE
That poppy looks great on you, Zulu.
Thank you very much, Captain! It's all thanks to your efforts.

Fields.MenuText: Are you finished handing them out to the crew?

Fields.DialogueText: The last one has just gone. We'd better get to work growing some more!

Fields.MenuText: Have you found somewhere to keep the garden safe?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm still thinking. I can't think of any place safer than by my side but you already occupy that position, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Perhaps we could grow another flower next time.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe... roses...
*ALARM*
Morganas! Quickly, Zulu!
Yes, Captain!
@BATTLE
I believe the most fun part of growing these flowers was watching them blossom naturally. Without force.
I agree. Gardening is best when the soil and the seedlings respect each other's pace.
I'm not one to rush things anyway. I'm enjoying the ride so far very much.
As am I, Captain. I hope to continue... gardening... with you in the future.
As would I. Shall I pop the kettle on?
Black tea, if you would. Got to be fresh for the rounds tonight.
... May I join you?
I'd be delighted, Captain. If you don't mind spending an evening knocking on doors.
Call it gardening.
Heh. Perhaps I shall.
